desc:
This unique spicy vinegar is made in the process of creating Hot Winter Hot Sauce. It's aromatic, briney and piquant.  A great addition to margaritas, spritzers, salad dressings, or for brining meats.  This version features the subtle natural smoky flavor of the Hot Winter pepper, but contains no actual smoked peppers. 
Heat Level: Mild
Ingredients: Organic Peppers, Kosher Salt, Organic Garlic.
5 oz

desc:
2017 is the Chinese "Year of the Fire Cock". In Chinese element theory each zodiac year is associated with one of five elements: Gold, Wood, Water, Fire, or Earth, which means that a Fire Cock comes once every 60-year cycle. Celebrate this Rooster's long awaited return with this fiery sweet chili sauce!
Heat Level: Extra Hot
Ingredients: ﻿Sweet Chile Sauce (Sugar, Water, Red Chiles, Distilled Vinegar, Garlic Salt, Xanthan Gum), Trinidad 7-Pot Chiles, Lime Juice.
5 oz

desc:
Red Grams is a butterscotch and raspberry mustard sauce with an irresistible smooth up front flavor and a hint of Caribbean flair. The mellow sweetness of the butterscotch accents the fresh raspberry and still allows for the tanginess of the mustard and the soft tones of our signature jerk seasoning to satisfy your palette.
Heat Level: Mild
Ingredients: Brown mustard, yellow mustard, apple cider vinegar, raspberry preserves, butterscotch, Jalapeño Pepper, Cayenne Pepper, onion puree, salt, Worcestershire, garlic spices & sodium benzoate.

desc:
Queen Majesty Red Habanero & Black Coffee Hot Sauce perfectly balances an exciting flavor with a sensational heat. It's their hottest recipe, using more than twice the amount of hot peppers than in their Scotch Bonnet & Ginger Sauce. It uses 3 types of vinegar: coffee-infused vinegar, Bragg's apple cider vinegar, and for extra depth of flavor they add in some pure balsamic vinegar. There won't be an overwhelming coffee flavor but what it does add is a nice smoky darkness that stands up to the intense flavor of the red habaneros. This sauce works great with rich foods like chilis, stews and pizza. 
Heat Level: Hot
Ingredients: Fair trade coffee-infused white vinegar, red bell peppers, onions, red habanero hot peppers, apple cider vinegar w/ mother, balsamic vinegar, garlic, olive oil, ginger root, salt and spices. 
5 oz

desc:
Queen Majesty Scotch Bonnet & Ginger Hot Sauce perfectly balances a vibrant flavor with a slow-burning heat. This original recipe is very loosely based off of a Jamaican jerk recipe, but more to compliment than compete with it. The brightness of the ginger and lime also work perfectly to spice up soups and curries or mix a little with honey and use for sweet potatoes or wings. This is a surprisingly versatile sauce and can be added to almost all of your favorite dishes.
Heat Level: Hot

Ingredients: White vinegar, sweet onions, orange bell peppers, scotch bonnet hot peppers, lime juice, ginger root, garlic, olive oil, salt and spices. 
Awards: Winner of Screaming Mimi's Gold Medal 2015 in the All Natural category at the NYC Hot Sauce Expo.
5 oz

desc:
Unholy Trinity by Irazu is an award-winning hot sauce that combines the three hottest peppers in the world: Carolina Reaper, Scorpion, and Ghost Pepper. 75% of this hot sauce is a combination of these scorching peppers and you will not find even a trace of extract to hinder the flavor.
Heat Level: Extra Hot
Ingredients: Scorpion Pepper, Carolina Reaper Pepper, Ghost Pepper, Water, Salt, Cane Vinegar, Onion, Lemon Juice, Garlic, Acetic Acid, Ascorbic Acid, Xanthan Gum.

desc:
Hot Winter Hot Sauce is made with organically grown heirloom peppers. It is the creation of Shaun Winter, who bred his own pepper after finding a rouge hot pepper in a field of mild Jimmy Nardellos. After 3 years, he perfected the Hot Winter pepper, a slightly sweet pepper with a slow building heat.
This version is the hottest of their current line, featuring the citrusy Bulgarian Carrot pepper along with the heat of the old Pennsylvanian Dutch Hinkelhatz. 
Heat Level: Hot
Ingredients: Organic Peppers (Hinkelhatz, Bulgarian Carrot, Hot Winter), Organic Rice and Cider Vinegars, Organic Cane Sugar, Kosher Salt, Organic Hardneck Garlic.

desc:
The word Ponzu means “Vinegar Punch” in the Japanese language. The combination of soy sauce, citrus, ginger, garlic and hot peppers makes Volcanic Pepper's Ghost Pepper Ponzu Sauce a great way to add some punch and terrific flavor to sushi, dumplings, egg rolls, or stir fry, and it also makes a great marinade for your steak or chicken. 
Heat Level: Hot
Ingredients: Soy Sauce, Brown Sugar, Lime, Lemon, Garlic, Rice Wine, Rice Vinegar, Ginger, Dried Ghost and Thai Peppers.
5 oz

desc:
Magic Sauce is an entirely unique sauce that is packed with umami. It's made with fermented soybean paste, a subtle hint of ginger and sesame, honey, and Carolina Reapers. The heat from the Reaper is delayed and manageable.  
Add a drop to literally anything to add a burst of umami. Goes great with gyoza, pot stickers, stir fry, fried rice, plain white rice, noodles, dumplings, ramen, steak, chicken, as a marinade, in a Bloody Mary, on a pizza, dim sims, spring rolls or added to a salad dressing. 
Heat Level: Hot/Extra Hot (depending on your tolerance)
Ingredients: Soy Protein, Onion, Sugar Syrup, Honey, Rice Vinegar, Fermented Soybean Paste, Fresh Carolina Reaper Chilli (5%), Garlic, Salt, Sesame Oil, Ginger
5.1 oz (150 ml)

Ingredients: Fresh Tomato, Sugar, Malt Vinegar (barley & wheat), Fresh Carolina Reaper Chilli (5%), Garlic, Onion, Spices, Worcestershire Sauce (contains anchovies), Molasses, Mustard Powder, Sea Salt, Citric Acid (330). Contains barley & wheat.
8.5 oz (250 ml)

2014 Mr Chilli Awards (Sydney, Australia) – 1st Place in the BBQ Sauce Category
2015 World Hot Sauce Awards (Louisiana, USA) – 3rd Place in the X Hot BBQ Sauce Category
2015 Zestfest Fiery Food Challenge (Texas, USA) – 3rd Place in the X Hot BBQ Sauce Category
2016 Scovie Awards (New Mexico, USA) – 2nd Place in the All-Natural Hot BBQ Sauce Category
2016 World Hot Sauce Awards (Louisiana, USA) – 2nd Place in the X Hot BBQ Sauce Category

desc:
Inspired by the exotic flavors of the Caribbean, this unique sauce features a tantalizing blend of papaya, pineapple, ginger, allspice and more — all brought together by the inclusion of pequin peppers, tiny fire starters that pack some serious back heat. Sweet and spicy in the best sense of the words, it’s the perfect topper for lighter meats like turkey breast, ham or pork loin, and a natural match for seafood.
Heat Level: Medium
Ingredients: Papaya, Onion, Pineapple Juice, Apple Cider Vinegar, Canola Oil, Ginger, Garlic, Sugar, Sea Salt, Pequin Peppers, Natural Vegetable Gums and Allspice.
Awards:
1st Place - Tropical Fruit Hot Sauce - 2012 Hot Pepper Awards.
1st Place - Unique Hot Sauce - 2012 Hot Pepper Awards

desc:
Primo’s Swampadelic Sauce comes to you from the ghostly and sweltering swamplands of Louisiana, where only gator and mad men survive. Born under a bad sign by a rock & roll genius who famously created the world record breaking “7 Pot Primo” pepper. Primo's pepper sauce is the sacrament of the new, hot pepper cultists and their heat-induced purging rituals. Only the blast furnace of the Deep South could give rise to such a monster.
This is a tasty pepper-forward sauce with some real serious heat, and very little vinegar flavor.
Heat Level: Superhot
Ingredients: Cider Vinegar, 7 Pot Primo and Aji Panca, Garlic, Cane Sugar, Lemon Flavor, Xanthan Gum.
Awards:

desc:
Men Pa'w is a unique Haitian style hot sauce full of flavor. It features a blend of Chocolate Habanero, Red Habanero, and Fatalii Peppers (among others), along with olive oil and Haitian spices.
Curious what the name means? According to Carline: "As for The name Men Pa’w… it is creole because I am from Haiti. The name means different things depending on the context in which you use it. For instance… “THIS IS YOURS”, “THIS IS THE BOMB”, “THIS IS IT”. I also chose the name as I saw it relates to my product because our sauce is very different. Many people find the name fun once they understand what it means." [quote from this review].
Heat Level: Hot
Ingredients: Apple Cider Vinegar, Olive Oil Blend (canola oil, olive oil), Onions, Water, Chocolate Habanero Peppers, Red Habanero Peppers, Fatalii Peppers, Soul Spice (salt, paprika, garlic, onion, curry powder, black pepper, celery, chili powder, red pepper, parsley, and cayenne pepper), Tropical Seasoning (salt, dehydrated garlic and onion, spices, paprika), Orange Habanero Peppers, Cayenne Peppers, Garlic, Red Scotch Bonnet Peppers, Granulated Garlic, Onion Powder.
 5 oz

desc:
"The 7-Pot Primo has been around since 2005. Rather obscure for quite a while, it packs an almost 1.5 million SHU rating! While other chiles have grabbed the limelight as " World's Hottest" this chile has flourished in the backwoods and swamps around Lafayette, Louisiana.  There is a lot of "which came first" controversy surrounding this pod, but we offer this straight forward sauce for your review. The only chile contained in this sauce is the 7-Pot Primo!" - From the label. They aren't joking, this stuff packs a punch.
Heat Level: Extreme
Ingredients:  7-Pot Primo Chiles, Distilled Vinegar, Cane Sugar, Sea Salt, Garlic, Spices, Lemon Extract.
5 oz

desc:
The hottest pepper in the world, in whole dried form! 
Reapers average 1,569,300 Scoville Heat Units (SHU), and can peak as high as 2,200,000 SHU. They were confirmed the worlds hottest by Guinness World Records on August 7th, 2013. 
Also be sure to check out our selection of Carolina Reaper sauces. One of our favorites is Foo Foo Mama Choo, which has a really nice balance of heat and flavor.
More information: For a good quick overview, check out this article by Guinness World Records, or for a more in-depth look, check out this great article in the New Yorker.
Ingredients: Whole Carolina Reaper Pods.
 International Shipping is available for $10 per 10 pack, or $24.95 for up to 2 oz.

desc:
Lucky Dog Hot Sauce's Brown Label is ridiculously tasty! It's a unique style of chipotle sauce with the rich notes of Meco chipotles and a dynamic balance between mustard, chipotle and cumin. Bartlett pear juice and figs add very subtle sweetness, while the creeping heat of the scotch bonnet chile brings the heat in a slow & sneaky way.

Ingredients: Cider Vinegar, Water, Onion, Chiles (Jalapeño, Dried Chipotle, and Dried Scotch Bonnet), Roasted Garlic, Pears, Figs, Sea Salt, Mustard Powder, Ghost Pepper Infused Sea Salt, Spices, Powdered Onions, Lime Juice Concentrate.

desc:
Akabanga is a one-of-a-kind chile oil imported from Rwanda. It has the pure flavor of the habanero, and a solid kick. It is great for cooking with or putting right on your food. 
Check out this article from The Cooking Channel about how Akabanga is the next cult-worthy hot sauce. Here's an excerpt:

"Look out, sriracha. If Akabanga ever makes it to the U.S.A., the heat will definitely be on. I mean, its little eyedropper bottle packaging alone could be cult-worthy, not to mention its unique flavor and kick."

Also check out this video from CNN on Akabanga. 
Heat Level: Medium-hot, depending on your tolerance.
Ingredients: Habanero (80%), Vegetable Oil (20%).
20 ml or 100 ml

desc:
Hot Winter Hot Sauce is made with organically grown heirloom peppers. It is the creation of Shaun Winter, who bred his own pepper after finding a rouge hot pepper in a field of mild Jimmy Nardellos. After 3 years, he perfected the Hot Winter pepper, a slightly sweet pepper with a slow building heat.
This is the original hot sauce in the line.
Heat Level: Medium
Ingredients: Organic Hot Winter Peppers, Organic Rice and Cider Vinegars, Organic Cane Sugar, Kosher Salt, Organic Hardneck Garlic.

Ingredients: Trinidad Scorpion Peppers, Cider Vinegar, Apricot Preserves, Water, Blueberries, Carrot, Honey, Onion, Soy Sauce, Sea Salt, Garlic, Ginger, White Pepper.

desc:
Made with an inventive blend of organic cayenne chilies, walnut oil, hazelnut oil, organic garlic, tomato paste, and salt, this sauce will blow you away. The Abyss is reminiscent of an asian chili oil, but instead of a soy oil they use decadent walnut and hazelnut oils. Great paired with cheeses, on pizza, or right out of the jar. 
Heat Level: Hot
Ingredients: Organic cayenne chillies, walnut oil, hazelnut oil, organic garlic, tomato paste, salt.

desc:
Chicaoji is a well balanced blend of raw organic apple cider vinegar, raw dried organic goji berries, organic chipotles, raw organic agave nectar, celtic sea salt, and raw organic cacao nibs. It’s made in small batches with certified organic ingredients on Lopez Island, WA. Try this sauce on any food, as a marinade, or dressing. 

Pronounced: chee-COW-gee.
Heat Level: Very Mild
Ingredients: Raw organic apple cider vinegar, water, raw dried organic goji berries, organic chipotle chiles, raw organic agave nectar, Celtic sea salt, raw organic cacao nibs.

desc:
Paul's Haba Haba is a mild-medium sauce blended with mango, mustard, and plenty of curry powder for an island inspired kick. Try it on pizza, fish, or burgers.
Heat Level: Medium. Note: the previous version was mild, but in the most recent batch Paul increased the amount of habanero to add some extra kick, so now it's a solid medium heat.

Ingredients: Mango Puree (water, mango), Yellow Mustard (Distilled Vinegar, Water, Mustard Seed, Salt, Tumeric, Paprika, Spices), Habanero Peppers, Brown Sugar, Distilled Vinegar, Spices, Salt, Xanthan Gum.

desc:
Yin Yang Hot Sauce is a smoky sauce that’s handcrafted in small batches with organic ingredients. The makers of Yin Yang Hot Sauce fire roast hand selected fresh habaneros to bring out their delicious flavor. It’s sweetened with organic fruit and organic spices to round out this flavorful sauce. 
Heat Level: Medium. There may be slight heat variations in each batch. 
Ingredients: Organic vinegar, organic fruit, organic peppers, organic spices, sea salt.
Wondering what type of fruit? We asked and they say it is a secret recipe. We'd love to hear from you if you think you can guess what it is. 
Not sure what to use it on? Check out our 5 Ways to Use Yin Yang blog post.

desc:
Lucky Dog Hot Sauce Purple Label is a distinctively bright and tangy jalapeño finishing sauce with all-natural hickory smoke flavor from smoked sea salts. While a mild sauce, there's still enough heat to light up the palate a bit - it's hot sauce, after all. 
Heat Level: Mild
Ingredients: Green Jalapeño Peppers, Distilled White Vinegar, Onions, Organic Applesauce, Garlic, Carrot Juice, Water, Carrots, Hickory Smoked Sea Salt, Mission Figs, Lime Juice Concentrate.
Awards:

desc:
Now in a larger 8.5 oz bottle!
Lucky Dog Black Label is made with fire-roasted Jalapeños, Trinidad Scorpion peppers, and a hint of Ghost Pepper infused sea salt. California black mission figs, Nana Mae's organic apples, white onions and copious amounts of garlic round out this sublimely versatile pepper sauce. Hints of lime give this sauce a spectacularly bright finish. 

Heat Level: Extra Hot (Note: this batch is hotter than previous batches. It used to be more of a 'hot' than 'extra hot', but now it's solidly in the extra hot range while maintaining its delicious flavor)

Ingredients: Onion, Cider Vinegar, Water, Apple Sauce, Chiles (Jalapeño and Scorpion Peppers), Garlic, Figs, Agave Syrup, Sea Salt, Ghost Pepper Infused Sea Salt, Lime Juice Concentrate.

desc:
Lucky Dog Hot Sauce Pink Label is an extra hot & extra delicious applewood smoked Habanero/Serrano/Ghost chile sauce, naturally sweetened with California Bartlett pears and luxurious dates from the Coachella valley of Southern California. 
Heat Level: Extra hot sauce, but on the milder side for an extra hot. Pink Label is a great entry point if you've never tried Ghost Peppers. To a seasoned chile head, it may come off as more of a 'hot', rather than extra hot. Note that the ghost pepper infused salt adds a slow building burn that keeps getting hotter the more you eat, so the first bite may be deceiving.
Ingredients: Distilled White Vinegar, Onions, Pears, Habanero Peppers, Garlic, Carrot Juice, Serrano Chili Peppers, Dates, Carrots, Water, Ghost Pepper Infused Sea Salt, Applewood Smoked Sea Salt, Lime Juice Concentrate. 
Awards: 

2015 I Love It Spicy "Lenny" Award, Product of the Year (based on highest average review score) 

2nd Place, 2014 Fiery Food Challenge, Hot Sauce: Hot - Consumer Ready
2016 The Hot Pepper Awards, 3rd Place, Smoky
2015 Fiery Food Challenge, 2nd Place, Hot Sauce, Pepper Blend

desc:
Lucky Dog Hot Sauce Red Label features a well balanced blend of Habanero, Jalapeno and Serrano peppers, creating a sweet-heat balance that's reminiscent of an Asian chile-garlic sauce. This is a med-hot, fire-roasted pepper sauce, rich with fresh & roasted garlic, carrots, onions and a mellow apple cider vinegar. 
An extremely versatile sauce, Red Label is well trained to be food's best friend and can be used on virtually anything from pasta and cheeseburgers to steak, on Mexican, Chinese, Italian, Thai, and Indian food. 
Heat Level: Medium
Ingredients: Cider Vinegar, Onion, Roasted Jalapeño, Water, Roasted Garlic, Carrot Juice, Chile Peppers, Sea Salt, Carrots, Cayenne Pepper, Agave, Lime Juice Concentrate.
Awards: 


2013 The Hot Pepper Awards - #1 Overall Category Winner, Hot Sauce

2013 The Hot Pepper Awards, 1st Place, "Sweet"
2nd Place, 2014 Fiery Food Challenge, Hot Sauce: Asian Style - Consumer Ready

desc:
Lucky Dog hot sauce Green Label features Jalapeño, Serrano and mild Cayenne peppers with sweet roasted garlic. This mild-to-medium fire-roasted hot pepper sauce uses carrots, onion and white vinegar to give it a tangy quality that compliments the Jalapeños perfectly.  
Heat Level: Mild. Want a hotter version? Try the Limited Edition Medium Hot Green Label w/Ghost Pepper here.
Ingredients: Water, Onion, Jalapeño, Roasted Garlic, Distilled White Vinegar, Carrot Juice, Serrano Pepper, Sea Salt, Agave Syrup, Carrot, Cayenne Pepper, Lime Juice Concentrate, Ghost Pepper Sea Salt.

names: Green Label Mild Fire-Roasted Pepper Sauce
desc_split: [Lucky Dog hot sauce Green Label features Jalapeño, Serrano and mild Cayenne peppers with sweet roasted garlic. This mild-to-medium fire-roasted hot pepper sauce uses carrots, onion and white vinegar to give it a tangy quality that compliments the Jalapeños perfectly.  , Heat Level: Mild. Want a hotter version? Try the Limited Edition Medium Hot Green Label w/Ghost Pepper here., Ingredients: Water, Onion, Jalapeño, Roasted Garlic, Distilled White Vinegar, Carrot Juice, Serrano Pepper, Sea Salt, Agave Syrup, Carrot, Cayenne Pepper, Lime Juice Concentrate, Ghost Pepper Sea Salt., Awards: , 2014  - Screaming Mimi's, 3rd Place - Jalapeño, 1st Place, Zestfest 2013, Golden Chile Award Winner, "Mild - Consumer Ready" , 2nd Place, Zestfest 2013, "Jalapeno - Consumer Ready", 2nd Place, The Hot Pepper Awards 2012, "Jalapeño", 3rd Place, 2013 The Hot Pepper Awards, "Pepper Blend", 8.5 oz]
descrip: Lucky Dog hot sauce Green Label features Jalapeño, Serrano and mild Cayenne peppers with sweet roasted garlic. This mild-to-medium fire-roasted hot pepper sauce uses carrots, onion and white vinegar to give it a tangy quality that compliments the Jalapeños perfectly.
ing: Water, Onion, Jalapeño, Roasted Garlic, Distilled White Vinegar, Carrot Juice, Serrano Pepper, Sea Salt, Agave Syrup, Carrot, Cayenne Pepper, Lime Juice Concentrate, Ghost Pepper Sea Salt.
